messages.subject: Re: New Website for Japanese auctions
messages.msgSnippet: Well Guys, I do not know how or if this service would be compatible with the purchase of swords due to the special hoops one must jump through to get
messages.messageBody:
Well Guys, I do not know how or if this service would be compatible
with the purchase of swords due to the special hoops one must jump
through to get exportation papers. In those cases my sellers have
done all that with no extra charge. Of course they are already
making a nice profit and why gild a goose. Most sellers seem to bend
over backwards to accommodate repeat trade. I would approach someone
I know, if needs be, to send a package, our small community would be
no loss to these outfits I'm sure with all the stuff else that is
auctioned. John -
-- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, Kenneth Wilson <kdw21620@...>
wrote:
>
> There are several similar services I have found so far
> http://www.mailorderjapan.com/yahoo-auction-japan/catmainframe.php?
caturl=http://auctions.yahoo.co.jp/jp/0-all.html
> http://www.crescent-shop.com/index08.html
> http://www.rinkya.com/bid.php
>
> I have been looking at these for about a year,
> mailorderjapan does have a unique translating service.
> I condone none of these. I had made a suggestion that
> the JSS/US could make a deal with one of these
> services for cheaper rates/caps for the membership. I
> assume that won't happen though.
>
> Rates are similar some 10%, 12%, some have
> protection, some only charge 500 yen for shipping (or
> actual cost if higher), each is a little different so
> you have to look at them all and how they operate to
> truly compare. The 8% seems to be the lowest.
>
> You also have to understand that banks in japan charge
> high fees and don't have free checking like in the US.
>
>
> I agree expensive at times, but likely cheaper than
> getting it here in the US and/or no availability here
> in the US.
>
> Ken aka Mantis dude
>
> --- MuramasaIII@... wrote:
>
> > I think checking items " through " their site you
> > get free
> > translation..........at least that's what I get with
> > that girlie photo auction.
> >

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: New Website for Japanese auctions
messages.msgSnippet: There are several siiliar services I have found so far
messages.messageBody:
There are several siiliar services I have found so far
http://www.mailorderjapan.com/yahoo-auction-japan/catmainframe.php?caturl=http://auctions.yahoo.co.jp/jp/0-all.html
http://www.crescent-shop.com/index08.html
http://www.rinkya.com/bid.php

I have been looking at these for about a year,
mailorderjapan does have a unique tranlating service.
I condone none of these. I had made a suggestion that
the JSS/US could make a deal with one of these
services for cheaper rates/caps for the membership. I
assume that won't happen though.

Rates are similiar some 10%, 12%, some have
protection, some only charge 500 yen for shipping (or
actual cost if higher), each is a little different so
you have to look at them all and how they operate to
truly compare. The 8% seems to be the lowest.

You also have to understand that banks in japan charge
high fees and don't have free checking like in the US.


I agree expensive at times, but likely cheaper than
getting it here in the US and/or no availibility here
in the US.

Ken aka Mantis dude

--- MuramasaIII@... wrote:

> I think checking items " through " their site you
> get free
> translation..........at least that's what I get with
> that girlie photo auction.
>
> Milt
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been
> removed]
>
>

messages.subject: Re: New Website for Japanese auctions
messages.msgSnippet: There s something interesting to this from a business standpoint.  As the buyer you have to deposit upfront the money through Paypal to their account which
messages.messageBody:
There's something interesting to this from a business standpoint. As
the buyer you have to deposit upfront the money through Paypal to
their account which they keep until the auction closes irreguardless
of whether you are the high bidder or not. Now think of this in
terms of if they get to be a big business. They could have quite a
large ammount of money on the kite -- making interest in their
account just like an insurance company does. And Paypal has a pretty
good interest percentage. Nice source of revenue! By the way -- they
aren't responsible for just about anything so read the fine print
carefully.
Pete Klein

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: New Website for Japanese auctions
messages.msgSnippet: John, Rich is right. They charge that 15%. The ones that charge 10% seem to have higher other charges so it feels like I am paying them 13 or 14%. If an item
messages.messageBody:
John,

Rich is right. They charge that 15%. The ones that
charge 10% seem to have higher 'other charges' so it
feels like I am paying them 13 or 14%. If an item is
worth less than $300, I almost don't bother bidding on
it, becuase the fees will eat me up.

That said, I've never tried buying a sword from Japan.
But occassionally a deal or a rare item can be found,
even with all the fees. I missed out on a nice papered
Yagyu tsuba earlier this year. Even with fees, it
would have been about 65% to 70% of what a dealer
would charge.

Curran

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: New Website for Japanese auctions
messages.msgSnippet: Hi John, I know what you are saying, though it is not much different from what Ebay charges for you to sell items at the end of an auction. It s the reverse in
messages.messageBody:
Hi John, I know what you are saying, though it is not much different
from what Ebay charges for you to sell items at the end of an auction.
It's the reverse in Japan ( as with most things ), the buyer pays. I
agree, on high priced items it bites, but on books and lower end items,
it can be quite reasonable.

Cheers

Rich

messages.subject: Re: New Website for Japanese auctions
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Rich, I really find fees on top of fees vexing. The $10000 sword was an example only. For me to get something from Japan, I already have 6 or 7% duty plus
messages.messageBody:
Hi Rich, I really find fees on top of fees vexing. The $10000 sword
was an example only. For me to get something from Japan, I already
have 6 or 7% duty plus 7% GST now if I went through a middleman
another 8% plus. This would seem innocuous on small purchases but it
adds up. If I could get 8% on purchases dealing in millions per year
(potentially) and on top of that internal shipping is paid and
external shipping is added plus the handling fee of $10 to pay my
staff, the 8% is gravy and I would be rich for doing nothing. The
15% you say some charge is just usurious. Maybe I'm cheap but that
is a good gaff. John -
-- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, Richard Turner <ikkanshi@...>
wrote:
>
> Hi John, actually, 8% is not bad, I know of dealers and buyers in
Japan
> who charge 15% and get good custom. The 1000JY fee is for internal
> shipping with in Japan. The issue is, many sellers in Japan won't
ship
> internationally. They don't want the bother, and they don't pack
items
> to ship out of the country. The intermediate buyer should handle
all
> that very well. Mine does.
>
> Of course everything is a risk and dropping 10K on a sword in an
online
> auction is pretty risky anyway unless you really know what you are
> doing. There's a lot to be said for holding something in the hand.
>
> Rich
>
> excelsiorilluminati wrote:
> > Hello Nichido, 8% on top of all the other fees does not seem
cheap
> > to me. If I was to buy a $10000 sword you get $800 dollars just
to
> > redirect it to me from a seller who could send it direct. Plus
1000
> > yen to have it delivered to you and the 1000 yen for who knows
what.
> > What would be the benefit? To us that is.
John -

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: New Website for Japanese auctions
messages.msgSnippet: Hi John, actually, 8% is not bad, I know of dealers and buyers in Japan who charge 15% and get good custom. The 1000JY fee is for internal shipping with in
messages.messageBody:
Hi John, actually, 8% is not bad, I know of dealers and buyers in Japan
who charge 15% and get good custom. The 1000JY fee is for internal
shipping with in Japan. The issue is, many sellers in Japan won't ship
internationally. They don't want the bother, and they don't pack items
to ship out of the country. The intermediate buyer should handle all
that very well. Mine does.

Of course everything is a risk and dropping 10K on a sword in an online
auction is pretty risky anyway unless you really know what you are
doing. There's a lot to be said for holding something in the hand.

Rich

messages.subject: Re: New Website for Japanese auctions
messages.msgSnippet: Hello Nichido, 8% on top of all the other fees does not seem cheap to me. If I was to buy a $10000 sword you get $800 dollars just to redirect it to me from a
messages.messageBody:
Hello Nichido, 8% on top of all the other fees does not seem cheap
to me. If I was to buy a $10000 sword you get $800 dollars just to
redirect it to me from a seller who could send it direct. Plus 1000
yen to have it delivered to you and the 1000 yen for who knows what.
What would be the benefit? To us that is. John -
-- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "nichido66" <nichido66@...>
wrote:

can

your
> home.

> <http://www.japanauctioncenter.com>
> The biggest advantage is that the bidding procedure is very simple
and
> service fees are low.
>
> Regards
> Nichido66

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: New Website for Japanese auctions
messages.msgSnippet: Maybe someone has experience of the hotel booking system in Japan?? Barry Thomas ... From: excelsiorilluminati  To:
messages.messageBody:
Maybe someone has experience of the hotel booking system in Japan??

Barry Thomas

----- Original Message -----
From: "excelsiorilluminati" <excelsiorilluminati@...>
To: <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, March 11, 2006 9:51 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: New Website for Japanese auctions


Hi Rich, I really find fees on top of fees vexing. The $10000 sword
was an example only. For me to get something from Japan, I already
have 6 or 7% duty plus 7% GST now if I went through a middleman
another 8% plus. This would seem innocuous on small purchases but it
adds up. If I could get 8% on purchases dealing in millions per year
(potentially) and on top of that internal shipping is paid and
external shipping is added plus the handling fee of $10 to pay my
staff, the 8% is gravy and I would be rich for doing nothing. The
15% you say some charge is just usurious. Maybe I'm cheap but that
is a good gaff. John

messages.subject: New Website for Japanese auctions
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, Nichido Ltd (Japan) has launched a new Website through which you can easily bid on Japanese online auctions and have your goods sent to your home.
messages.messageBody:
Hi,

Nichido Ltd (Japan) has launched a new Website through which you can
easily bid on Japanese online auctions and have your goods sent to your
home.

www.japanauctioncenter.com
<http://www.japanauctioncenter.com>
The biggest advantage is that the bidding procedure is very simple and
service fees are low.

Regards
Nichido66




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
